snippet: Mike Trout of the Los Angeles Angels became the youngest American League Rookie of the Year in a unanimous vote, and Bryce Harper of the Washington Nationals won the National League award.
abstract: Los Angeles Angels center fielder Mike Trout, at 21 years old, becomes youngest American League player to win Rookie of the Year award; 20-year-old Washington Nationals center fielder Bryce Harper becomes second-youngest National League winner, edged out by 1984 honoree Dwight Gooden.
lead_paragraph: Mike Trout of the Los Angeles Angels became the youngest American League Rookie of the Year in a unanimous vote, and Bryce Harper of the Washington Nationals won the National League award.

headline.seo: Mike Trout and Bryce Harper Voted Baseball’s Rookies of the Year
headline.main: Trout and Harper Voted Baseball’s Top Rookies
headline.print_headline: Trout and Harper Among Youngest to Receive Rookie of the Year Award
